conclusion: Analyze forces to find coefficient of friction (μ) and angle (θ).
Identify forces: Weight (W), Normal Force (N), Applied Force (F), Frictional Force (f).
Frictional Force (f) is proportional to Normal Force (N): f = μN.
Resolve Applied Force into components: F_x = F cos θ, F_y = F sin θ.
Vertical equilibrium: N + F_y = W, N = 150 - 90 sin θ.
Horizontal equilibrium: F_x = f, 90 cos θ = μN.
Substitute N into horizontal equation: 90 cos θ = μ(150 - 90 sin θ).
Solve for μ: μ = 90 cos θ / (150 - 90 sin θ).
Minimum pull is 90 N; find θ that minimizes force.
Use sin 37° = 0.6 to check if θ = 37° satisfies conditions.
Substitute θ = 37° into μ equation: μ = 72 / 96 = 0.75.
Final Answer: Coefficient of Friction (μ) is 0.75, Angle (θ) is 37°.
